inputs.name: version
inputs.description: show program's version number and exit

inputs.name: dicom_dir_template
inputs.description: Location of dicomdir that can be indexed with subject id {subject} and session {session}. Tarballs (can be compressed) are supported in addition to directory. All matching tarballs for a subject are extracted and their content processed in a single pass. If multiple tarballs are found, each is assumed to be a separate session and the --ses argument is ignored. Note that you might need to surround the value with quotes to avoid {...} being considered by shell

inputs.name: files
inputs.description: Files (tarballs, dicoms) or directories containing files to process. Cannot be provided if using --dicom_dir_template.

inputs.name: subjs
inputs.description: List of subjects - required for dicom template. If not provided, DICOMS would first be "sorted" and subject IDs deduced by the heuristic.

inputs.name: converter
inputs.description: Tool to use for DICOM conversion. Setting to "none" disables the actual conversion step -- useful for testing heuristics.

inputs.name: outdir
inputs.description: Output directory for conversion setup (for further customization and future reference. This directory will refer to non-anonymized subject IDs.

inputs.name: locator
inputs.description: Study path under outdir. If provided, it overloads the value provided by the heuristic. If --datalad is enabled, every directory within locator becomes a super-dataset thus establishing a hierarchy. Setting to "unknown" will skip that dataset.

inputs.name: conv_outdir
inputs.description: Output directory for converted files. By default this is identical to --outdir. This option is most useful in combination with --anon-cmd.

inputs.name: anon_cmd
inputs.description: Command to run to convert subject IDs used for DICOMs to anonymized IDs. Such command must take a single argument and return a single anonymized ID. Also see --conv-outdir.

inputs.name: heuristic
inputs.description: Name of a known heuristic or path to the Python script containing heuristic.

inputs.name: with_prov
inputs.description: Store additional provenance information. Requires python-rdflib.

inputs.name: session
inputs.description: Session for longitudinal study_sessions. Default is None.

inputs.name: bids_options
inputs.description: Flag for output into BIDS structure. Can also take BIDS-specific options, e.g., --bids notop. The only currently supported options is "notop", which skips creation of top-level BIDS files. This is useful when running in batch mode to prevent possible race conditions.

inputs.name: overwrite
inputs.description: Overwrite existing converted files.

inputs.name: datalad
inputs.description: Store the entire collection as DataLad dataset(s). Small files will be committed directly to git, while large to annex. New version (6) of annex repositories will be used in a "thin" mode so it would look to mortals as just any other regular directory (i.e. no symlinks to under .git/annex). For now just for BIDS mode.

inputs.name: debug
inputs.description: Do not catch exceptions and show exception traceback.

inputs.name: command
inputs.description: Custom action to be performed on provided files instead of regular operation.

inputs.name: grouping
inputs.description: How to group dicoms (default: by studyUID).

inputs.name: minmeta
inputs.description: Exclude dcmstack meta information in sidecar jsons.

inputs.name: random_seed
inputs.description: Random seed to initialize RNG.

inputs.name: dcmconfig
inputs.description: JSON file for additional dcm2niix configuration.

inputs.name: queue
inputs.description: Batch system to submit jobs in parallel.

inputs.name: queue_args
inputs.description: Additional queue arguments passed as a single string of space-separated Argument=Value pairs.
